factoid: The princess held her little dog on her lap with her thin bony hands.
The princess looked attentively into Prince Vasíli’s eyes.
The princess was evidently resolved not to be the first to break silence if she had to wait till morning.
Prince Vasíli addressed the princess and cousin Catherine Semënovna.
Prince Vasíli said at such a moment as this one must think of everything.
Prince Vasíli said one must think of the future.
Prince Vasíli said one must think of all of you.
Prince Vasíli said I love you all, like children of my own, as you know.
The princess continued to look at Prince Vasíli without moving, with the same dull expression.
Prince Vasíli said my family has also to be considered.
Prince Vasíli said we—Catherine Semënovna, the three sisters, Mámontov, and his wife—are the count’s only direct heirs.
Prince Vasíli said he knows how hard it is for the princess to talk or think of such matters.
Prince Vasíli said it is no easier for him; but he is getting on for sixty and must be prepared for anything.
Prince Vasíli said he has sent for Pierre.
The count demanded that Pierre should be called.
Prince Vasíli looked questioningly at the princess.
Prince Vasíli could not make out whether the princess was considering what he had just said or simply looking at him.
The princess replied that she constantly prays to God to grant that He would be merciful to him and would allow his noble soul peacefully to leave this.
Prince Vasíli interrupted saying yes, yes, of course.
Prince Vasíli said but in short, the fact is that last winter the count made a will by which he left all his property not to us his direct heirs but to Pierre.
The princess said he has made wills enough.
The princess said Pierre is illegitimate.
The princess said he cannot leave the estate to Pierre.
Prince Vasíli asked what if a letter has been written to the Emperor in which the count asks for Pierre’s legitimation.
Prince Vasíli asked if the princess understood that in consideration of the count’s services, his request would be granted.
The princess smiled as people do who think they know more about the subject under discussion than those she is talking with.
Prince Vasíli said that the letter was written, though it was not sent, and the Emperor knew of it.
Prince Vasíli said the only question is whether the letter has been destroyed or not.
Prince Vasíli said if not, then as soon as all is over and the count’s papers are opened, the will and letter will be delivered to the Emperor, and the petition will certainly be granted.
Prince Vasíli said Pierre will get everything as the legitimate son.
The princess asked what our share is.
Prince Vasíli said he will then be the legal heir to everything and the princess won’t get anything.
Prince Vasíli said the princess must know whether the will and letter were written and whether they have been destroyed or not.
Prince Vasíli said if they have somehow been overlooked, the princess ought to know where they are and must find them.
The princess interrupted asking what next.
The princess said she is a woman and Prince Vasíli thinks they are all stupid.
The princess said she knows that an illegitimate son cannot inherit.
The princess added that a bastard is a bastard.
Prince Vasíli said well, really, Catiche.

Prince Vasíli said you are so intelligent, how is it you don’t see that if the count has written a letter to the Emperor begging him to recognize Pierre as legitimate, it follows that Pierre will not be Pierre but will become Count Bezúkhov.
Prince Vasíli said Pierre will then inherit everything under the will.
Prince Vasíli said if the will and letter are not destroyed, then the princess will have nothing but the consolation.
Prince Vasíli said that’s certain.
